description: Maximum cardinality of finite D0L sequence over an alphabet with n symbols.
comments: Note that a(n) is prime for n = 1, 2, 4, 6, 11, 13, 18, 20, 31. - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Oct 01 2005
references: O. Osterby, Prime decompositions with minimum sum, Matematisk Institut, Aarhus Universitet, Technical Report DAIMI PB-19, November 1973;
O. Osterby, Prime decompositions with minimum sum, Nordisk Tidskr. Informationsbehandling (BIT) 16 (1976), 451-458;
P. M. B. Vitanyi, Lindenmayer Systems: Structure, Languages and Growth Functions, Mathematisch Centrum, Math. Centre Tracts #96, 1980, p. 25.
formula: Max { Prod p^a + d : Sum p^a + d = n }, p prime
example: a(11) = 31 because we can write 11 = 1 + 2 + 3 + 5 and 31 = 1+2*3*5
author: _Jeffrey Shallit_
extensions: First 4 values appear incorrectly in cited references; corrected by JOS
